fr.uga.pddl4j.parser

Class Exp

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.uga.pddl4j.parser.Exp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Exp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements a parser node used in PDDL expressions.

    Modifications:

    • Add method isLiteral() 11.12.2012.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Creates a new planning node with a specified connective.

      Creates a new expression from a other one.

      • renameVariables

        public void renameVariables()
                     throws MalformedExpException
        Renames the variables contained in the expression. The variable renames have the form ?X1,..., ?Xn.
        Throws:
        MalformedExpException - if this expression is malformed.
        See Also:
        this#isMalformedExpression()

      • renameVariables

        public void renameVariables(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> context)
                     throws MalformedExpException
        Renames the variables contained in the expression with a specified symbol, i.e., the variable already renamed. The variable renames have the form ?X1, ..., ?Xn.
        Parameters:
        context - the images of the renamed variable.
        Throws:
        MalformedExpException - if this expression is malformed.
        See Also:
        this#isMalformedExpression()

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - the other object.

      • contains

        public final boolean contains(Exp exp)
        Returns if a specified expression is contains, i.e., is a sub-expression of this expression. More formally, returns true if and only if this expression contains at least one subexpression s such that s.equals(exp).
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to test.
        Returns:
        true if the specified expression exp is a sub-expression of this expression; false otherwise.

      • remove

        public final boolean remove(Exp exp)
        Removes all the occurrences of a specified expression contained in this expression and returns true if and only if at least one occurrence was removed.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the specified expression exp was removed; false otherwise.

        MalformedExpException - if the expression is malformed.
        See Also:

      • isMalformedExpression

        public boolean isMalformedExpression()
        Return if this expression is malformed. An expression is considered as well in the following cases:
      • Empty OR and AND expressions, i.e., without any children, are considered as well formed.
      • Quantified expressions (EXISTS, FORALL) is well formed if it has at least one quantified variable and one child expression.
      • ATOM and F_HEAD expressions without any symbols as arguments are considered as well formed.
      • EQUAL_ATOM expression with two symbols as arguments is considered as well formed.
      • NOT, UMINUS, AT_START, AT_END, OVER_ALL, ALWAYS, SOMETIME, AT_MOST_ONCE, MINIMIZE, MAXIMIZE and F_EXP_T expressions must have at least one child expression to be considered as well formed.
      • FN_ATOM, WHEN, DURATION_ATOM, LESS, LESS_OR_EQUAL, EQUAL, GREATER, GREATER_OR_EQUAL, ASSIGN, INCREASE, DECREASE, SCALE_UP, SCALE_DOWN, MUL, DIV, MINUS, PLUS, SOMETIME_AFTER, SOMETIME_BEFORE, HOLD_AFTER and WITHIN must have at least two children expressions to be considered as well formed.
      • ALWAYS_WITHIN and HOLD_DURING must have at least three children expressions to be considered as well formed.
Returns:
true if the expression is malformed; false otherwise.
